intro: Lychnis triflora subsp. dawsonii, commonly known as Dawson's pink, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces clusters of small, rounded flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger flowers and more robust growth compared to the typical form of Lychnis triflora.
